distributional 0.3.1.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.04296137  9.79509056
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.060930 1.048296
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.02082711 -0.30807483
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.7951699  1.0840729  0.1968758  0.4587949 -1.2191815  0.1808718
#>  [7] -0.2700229 -0.7714127 -0.1681458  1.4907873
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.861823 11.019542  9.118986 10.641710  9.858252  9.135897  8.622212
#>  [8] 11.532131  9.351263  9.776499
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2129041 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.27547 10.02557
variance(dist)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,] 0.70804336 0.01103707
#> [2,] 0.01103707 0.84852820
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.008695902
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -0.09182519 10.405640
#>  [2,] -0.29509908 10.486456
#>  [3,]  0.13496324  9.281350
#>  [4,] -0.69760364  9.352272
#>  [5,]  1.98530230  9.492620
#>  [6,] -1.27509827 10.919763
#>  [7,]  0.04919984 10.417113
#>  [8,] -1.51663310  9.701217
#>  [9,] -0.39968479  8.792170
#> [10,]  1.98530230  9.492620
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.3074533 0.0000000
